articles.title: Cisco earnings are out Wednesday. What top analysts expect to see
articles.summary: Cisco shares are up more than 20% year to date, largely driven by enthusiasm pouring into artificial intelligence infrastructure and cybersecurity demand.

articles.title: Tom Lee: Ethereum Is 'The Biggest Macro Trade' For The Next 10-15 Years

articles.title: AI chip startup Rivos seeks up to $500 million in funding to take on Nvidia
articles.summary: In the race to supply the hardware behind artificial intelligence, few names have risen as quickly as Rivos. The Santa Clara startup, best known for its RISC-V-based server chips, pulled in $250 million just a year ago. Now it‚Äôs aiming much higher, with plans to raise between $400 million and $500 million in fresh capital,

articles.title: CoreWeave drops 14% on wider-than-expected loss ahead of lockup expiry
articles.summary: CoreWeave's stock dropped about 14% after the renter of artificial intelligence data centers reported a bigger-than-expected loss.
articles.translated_title: CoreWeave drops 14% on wider-than-expected loss ahead of lockup expiry

articles.title: Elon Musk says he plans to sue Apple for not featuring X or Grok among its top apps
articles.summary: Billionaire SpaceX, Tesla and X owner Elon Musk says he plans to sue Apple for not featuring X and its Grok artificial intelligence chatbot app in its top recommended apps in its App Store.
articles.translated_title: Elon Musk says he plans to sue Apple for not featuring X or Grok among its top apps

articles.title: Companies Are Pouring Billions Into A.I. It Has Yet to Pay Off.
articles.summary: Corporate spending on artificial intelligence is surging as executives bank on major efficiency gains. So far, they report little effect to the bottom line.
articles.translated_title: Companies Are Pouring Billions Into A.I. It Has Yet to Pay Off.
articles.translated_summary: Corporate spending on artificial intelligence is surging as executives bank on major efficiency gains. So far, they report little effect to the bottom line.

articles.title: Tencent Plans Cautious AI Spending After Results Beat Estimates
articles.summary: Tencent Holdings Ltd. promised prudence in AI spending despite faster-than-anticipated growth across its gaming and advertising businesses, suggesting China‚Äôs most valuable company intends to adopt a more measured approach to artificial intelligence development than many of its global rivals.
